description: 2-hour 15-minute examination with multiple-choice and short answer questions assessing content from weeks 1-10. Tests recollection, understanding, and application of forensic anthropology principles.

Group assessment involving anthropological investigation of skeletal remains. Includes a written report (12.5%), peer review (5%), and oral presentation (2.5%). Evaluates analysis accuracy, communication skills, and peer collaboration.
1-hour practical test during exam period assessing identification of human bones, application of forensic techniques, and analysis of skeletal remains from second half of term.
1-hour practical test in Week 5 assessing identification of human bones, application of forensic techniques, and analysis of skeletal remains from first half of term.
